Study Title: On the interplay between consistency, completeness, and correctness in requirements evolution
Description of Method: Copy relevant missing information from previous version of requirements/domain model.

Study Title: Use case patterns driven requirements engineering
Description of Method: An approach that uses a pre-constructed use case patterns catalogue as a starting point for requirements elicitation and modeling, followed by customization and addition of project-specific requirements.

Study Title: Domain component-based service requirements modeling and analysis
Description of Method: After constructing the initial Requirement Component Directed Graph, the method includes a step to optimize the RC model.

Study Title: Automated requirements engineering: Use case patterns-driven approach
Description of Method: Continuously update the use case patterns catalogue with new patterns discovered during projects.

Study Title: Enhancing domain knowledge for requirements elicitation with Web mining
Description of Method: A method to enhance domain ontologies by adding general concepts mined from web documents to complement domain-specific concepts.

Study Title: Yet another set of requirement metrics for software projects
Description of Method: A set of 15 steps to follow for more accurate and planned requirement gathering.

Study Title: Measuring complexity and completeness of KAOS goal models
Description of Method: The paper demonstrates a process of refining an incomplete KAOS goal model to improve its completeness.

Study Title: Automating scenario-driven structured requirements engineering
Description of Method: Synthesizing requirements models from a set of scenarios to ensure completeness.

Study Title: Improving requirements quality using essential use case interaction patterns
Description of Method: A visual approach to highlight differences between the extracted EUC model and the matched pattern template, allowing users to interactively resolve incompleteness.
Method Categories: Requirement Patterns and Templates, Tool-Guided Refinement

Study Title: Completeness and consistency analysis on requirements of distributed event-driven systems
Description of Method: This method involves identifying unspecified nodes in the condition guard tree and providing options for addressing these incomplete areas.

Study Title: Using domain ontology as domain knowledge for requirements elicitation
Description of Method: A systematic approach to improve requirements completeness using domain ontologies.

Study Title: Assessment of high integrity software components for completeness, consistency, fault-tolerance, and reliability
Description of Method: This method involves iteratively refining the Z specifications based on issues uncovered during Statechart simulation.

Study Title: Generating obstacle conditions for requirements completeness
Description of Method: The approach iteratively generates obstacles and allows analysts to select significant ones, negate them, and add them to the background properties for further analysis.

Study Title: Systems and context modeling approach to requirements analysis
Description of Method: This approach involves creating structured models of stakeholder needs, system requirements, and domain knowledge. It allows for easier identification and correction of inconsistencies and incompleteness.

Study Title: Automated completeness check in KAOS
Description of Method: The paper demonstrates a process of iteratively refining goals, assigning agents, and associating operations to correct incompleteness in KAOS models.

Study Title: TestMEReq: Generating abstract tests for requirements validation
Description of Method: TestMEReq supports an iterative process of requirements validation and correction through the generation and review of abstract tests and UI prototypes.

Study Title: A TASM-based requirements validation approach for safety-critical embedded systems
Description of Method: A systematic approach to model requirements using the extended TASM language, which helps in identifying and addressing incompleteness.

Study Title: A framework for completeness in requirements engineering: An application in aircraft maintenance scenario
Description of Method: A structured process following three dimensions (analysis, integration, and structure) to elicit and write requirements in a way to achieve a sufficient degree of completeness.

Study Title: Using correctness, consistency, and completeness patterns for automated scenarios verification
Description of Method: Uses a catalog of Non-Functional Requirements (NFR) patterns to organize properties related to completeness and guide the correction process.

Study Title: Assessing requirements-related risks through probabilistic goals and obstacles
Description of Method: Selecting and applying countermeasures to resolve critical obstacles.

Study Title: Measuring and improving the completeness of natural language requirements
Description of Method: An interactive tool that suggests relevant terms and relations from input documents to the requirements engineer during the requirements writing process.

Study Title: Improving software quality requirements specifications using spectrum analysis
Description of Method: Applies recommendation rules to suggest quality requirements that should be added to functional requirements to improve completeness.

Study Title: Analysing sanity of requirements for avionics systems
Description of Method: Suggests new LTL formulae to improve completeness.
Method Categories: Automated Suggestions, Tool-Guided Refinement, Iterative Completeness Enhancement

Study Title: Challenging Incompleteness of Performance Requirements by Sentence Patterns
Description of Method: Using the proposed sentence patterns to specify performance requirements, ensuring completeness by construction.

Study Title: Metrics for measuring complexity and completeness for social goal models
Description of Method: The paper suggests using the metrics as a feedback mechanism to guide the refinement and completion of i* models.

Study Title: Validation framework for aspectual requirements engineering (ValFAR)
Description of Method: Decomposing general concerns into sub-concerns.

Study Title: Using Language Models for Enhancing the Completeness of Natural-Language Requirements
Description of Method: The approach uses BERT to generate predictions for masked words in requirements, then applies a machine learning-based filter to reduce noise in the predictions. The resulting list of recommended terms can be used to identify and potentially correct incompleteness in requirements.

Study Title: An approach: SysML-based automated completeness evaluation of the system requirements specification
Description of Method: The paper implicitly suggests an iterative process of refining and satisfying requirements based on the completeness metrics.

Study Title: Requirements Capture and Analysis in ASSERT(TM)
Description of Method: Requirements are captured, analyzed, and then refined based on the analysis results.

Study Title: Forward engineering completeness for software by using requirements validation framework
Description of Method: A framework to validate requirements and identify necessary adjustments before software development.

Study Title: Improving requirements completeness: automated assistance through large language models
Description of Method: Uses BERT to generate predictions for masked words in requirements, applies filtering to remove non-relevant predictions, and recommends remaining terms as potentially missing terminology.

Study Title: A tool-based boilerplate technique to improve SRS quality: An evaluation
Description of Method: A prototype tool that guides requirements engineers in writing complete software requirements for a generic information management system.
Method Categories: Requirement Patterns and Templates, Tool-Guided Refinement

Study Title: An intelligent recommender system based on association rule analysis for requirement engineering
Description of Method: Uses discovered association rules to suggest potentially missing requirements to users.

Study Title: Sense: A flow-down semantics-based requirements engineering framework
Description of Method: Recommends appropriate standardized requirement expressions (boilerplates) based on requirement type and system context.
Method Categories: Requirement Patterns and Templates, Automated Suggestions

Study Title: Enhancing Requirements Completeness of Automated Driving System in Concept Phase
Description of Method: Various techniques to capture stakeholder needs, including strategy documents, technical documents, prototypes, interviews, brainstorming sessions, modeling and simulation reports.

Study Title: PolicyChecker: Analyzing the GDPR Completeness of Mobile Apps' Privacy Policies
Description of Method: A set of recommendations provided to app developers to improve the completeness of their apps' privacy policies.

Study Title: Evaluation of software requirement specification based on IEEE 830 quality properties
Description of Method: The prototype suggests possible amendments to the SRS structure based on detected synonym topics and missing IEEE 830 topics.

Study Title: A granular conceptual model to define requirements for evaluating the functional completeness of a pharmacy information system
Description of Method: A framework that guides the definition of requirements by breaking them down into five key areas to ensure comprehensive coverage of all aspects of a requirement.

Study Title: Meta-requirement method towards analyzing completeness of requirements specification
Description of Method: The proposed approach involves building a repository of meta-requirements and using it to perform a gap analysis between different systems in the same domain.

Study Title: USQA: A User Story Quality Analyzer prototype for supporting software engineering students
Description of Method: The USQA tool provides feedback to users about the completeness of their user stories, allowing them to correct and improve their writing.

Study Title: Automatic recommendation to omitted steps in use case specification
Description of Method: The approach recommends appropriate steps for the omitted parts of use case scenarios based on extracted scenario patterns.
Method Categories: Automated Suggestions, Requirement Patterns and Templates

Study Title: Requirements in the loop: A computer-Aided analysis of consistency, completeness, and correctness of requirements
Description of Method: An iterative approach where formalization and analysis results are used to identify and correct issues in requirements.
